it.essepuntato.earmark.core
Class EARMARKDocument

java.lang.Object
  it.essepuntato.earmark.core.EARMARKDocument
All Implemented Interfaces:
EARMARKHierarchicalNode, EARMARKItem, EARMARKNode, java.lang.Cloneable
public class EARMARKDocument
extends java.lang.Object
implements EARMARKItem, EARMARKHierarchicalNode

This class represents an EARMARK document. Is is used to create new markup items (elements, attributes, comments) and ranges (pointer and xpath pointer ranges).

Author:
Silvio Peroni

Field Detail

SEPARATOR

public static final java.lang.String SEPARATOR
It represents the URI separator for the name of the items when an id is not specified or it is specified locally.

See Also:
Constant Field Values
Constructor Detail

EARMARKDocument

public EARMARKDocument(java.net.URI uri)
Create an empty EARMARKDocument.

Parameters:
uri - The URI to associate to the document.
Method Detail

removeRange

public boolean removeRange(Range range)
This method removes the range specified from the document. If the range is the only one that refers to a docuverse, then the docuverse itself will be removed as well.

Parameters:
range - the range to be removed.
Returns:
true if the range is correctly removed, false otherwise (i.e., if the range is not own by the document).

removeMarkupItem

public boolean removeMarkupItem(MarkupItem markupitem)

This method removes a markup item from the document.

Removing a markup item means to remove all its descendant as well, unless they have more than one parent.

Parameters:
markupitem - the markup item to be removed.
Returns:
true if the markup item is correctly removed, false otherwise (i.e., if the markup item is not own by the document).

removeMarkupItem

protected boolean removeMarkupItem(MarkupItem markupitem,
                                   boolean strong)

This method removes a markup item from the document.

Parameters:
markupitem - the markup item to be removed.
strong - if true, this method removes all the descendant of the input node without any check. Otherwise, if false, only the descendants that have one parent only will be removed.
Returns:
true if the markup item is correctly removed, false otherwise (i.e., if the markup item is not own by the document).

getEntityById

public EARMARKItem getEntityById(java.net.URI id)
This method allows to get an EARMARK item through its id.

Parameters:
id - the identifier of the item to be returned.
Returns:
the item related to the input id.

getEntityById

public EARMARKItem getEntityById(java.lang.String id)

This method allows to get an EARMARK item through its id.

When the string do not comply with the complete URL syntax (i.e., [protocol] + :// + domain + resource path), the string will be completed automatically with the path of the current document id. For instance, if the input string is "p14" and the document id is the URI "http://www.example.com/mydocument", then the resulting id considered by this method will be "http://www.example.com/mydocument" + SEPARATOR + "p14".

Parameters:
id - the complete string for the URI identifying of the item to be returned.
Returns:
the item related to the input id.

getMarkupItemByGeneralIdentifier

public java.util.Set<MarkupItem> getMarkupItemByGeneralIdentifier(java.lang.String gi)

This method returns a set of markup items having a particular general identifier associated.

If the general identifier specified is null or "", the method looks for all the entities that do not have any general identifier specified.

Parameters:
gi - the general identifier for the entities to be retrieved.
Returns:
a set of markup items having the input general identifier specified.

getMarkupItemByGeneralIdentifierAndNamespace

public java.util.Set<MarkupItem> getMarkupItemByGeneralIdentifierAndNamespace(java.lang.String gi,
                                                                              java.net.URI ns)

This method returns a set of markup items having a particular general identifier and namespace associated.

If the general identifier specified is null or "", the method looks for all the entities that do not have any general identifier specified. In the same way, if the namespace is null or "", the method looks for all the entities that do not have any namespace specified.

Parameters:
gi - the general identifier for the entities to be retrieved.
ns - the namespace for the entities to be retrieved.
Returns:
a set of markup items having the input general identifier and the namespace specified.

getReader

public static EARMARKReader getReader()

This method returns the I/O reader processor currently set for this class. The processor will be used for converting a source EARMARK document into its Java representation.

By default, the reader is a JenaReader.

Returns:
the reader processor for converting source EARMARK documents into their Java representations.

setReader

public static void setReader(EARMARKReader reader)
This method allows to set a particular I/O reader processor that will be used for converting a source EARMARK document into its Java representation.

Parameters:
reader - the I/O reader to be considered.

getWriter

public static EARMARKWriter getWriter()

This method returns the I/O writer processor currently set for this class. The processor will be used for converting a Java representation of an EARMARK document into a particular format, chosen from the set of formats handled by the writer itself.

By default, the writer is a JenaWriter.

Returns:
the writer processor for converting Java representations of an EARMARK documents into particular formats.

setWriter

public static void setWriter(EARMARKWriter writer)
This method allows to set a particular I/O writer processor that will be used for converting a Java representation of an EARMARK document into a particular format, chosen from the set of formats handled by the writer itself

Parameters:
writer - the I/O writer to be considered.

getIdMap

protected java.util.Map<java.net.URI,EARMARKItem> getIdMap()

This method returns all the ids of the EARMARK document. Each modification to this set is not propagated to all the structures involved and, consequently, may result in wrong behaviours and/or collateral effects.

It is usually reserved for internal use only.

Returns:
all the ids of the EARMARK document.

setId

protected boolean setId(EARMARKItem item,
                        java.net.URI newId)

This method changes the local id of an item with a new one. Each modification to the id is not propagated to all the structures involved and, consequently, may result in wrong behaviours and/or collateral effects.

It is usually reserved for internal use only.

Parameters:
item - the item in which we want to change the id.
newId - the new id for the input item.
Returns:
true if the id is changed, false otherwise (i.e., the new id is the same of the old one).

createStringDocuverse

public StringDocuverse createStringDocuverse(java.lang.String id,
                                             java.lang.String content)
                                      throws ExistingIdException

This method creates a new string docuverse.

When the id do not comply with the complete URL syntax (i.e., [protocol] + :// + domain + resource path), the id will be completed automatically with the path of the current document id. For instance, if the input id string is "p14" and the document id is the URI "http://www.example.com/mydocument", then the resulting id string considered by this method will be "http://www.example.com/mydocument" + SEPARATOR + "p14".

Parameters:
id - the identifier of the new docuverse.
content - the string content of the new docuverse.
Returns:
a new string docuverse.
Throws:
ExistingIdException - if the identifier specified is already used in the document.

copyNode

public EARMARKChildNode copyNode(EARMARKChildNode node,
                                 boolean deep)

This method copies to this document a node contained in another document.

Only items that are not already present in the document will be correctly copied. This means that an item, having identifier "ID" and belonging to a particular document, will be copied if and only if in the copying document does not exist any item having "ID" as identifier.

If the node to be copied is a range, its referred docuverse will be copied as well.

Parameters:
node - the node to be copied.
deep - if true, the copy is applied recursively on all the children of the node, otherwise the method copies the node definition only. When deep is true, it may occur of having an incomplete copy of the input node: it will lack any descendant item that has an identifier in common with any of those contained in the copying document.
Returns:
the copied node as part of the copying document or null if the copy of the node fails.

cloneNode

public EARMARKNode cloneNode(boolean deep)
This method clones the document.

Specified by:
cloneNode in interface EARMARKNode
Parameters:
deep - if false, it corresponds to call the method clone(); if true, the document will be cloned using the method clone() and then all the other items of the original document will be copied to the cloned one.
Returns:
the cloned document.

getNextSibling

protected EARMARKChildNode getNextSibling(EARMARKChildNode node)
This method returns the next siblings of the node specified. If more than one siblings exist, it choose randomly among the next siblings list. Though in a common XML document there exists one possible next sibling only, in EARMARK it is possible to have more than one sibling, because of different hierarchies and multiple references.

Parameters:
node - the node we are asking for its next sibling.
Returns:
a next siblings of the node or null if it does not exist.

Parameters:
node - the node we are asking for its next siblings.
Returns:
a set containing all the next siblings of the node.

insertBefore

public EARMARKChildNode insertBefore(EARMARKChildNode newChild,
                                     EARMARKChildNode refChild)
                              throws EARMARKGraphException
Description copied from interface: EARMARKHierarchicalNode
Inserts the node newChild before the first existing child node refChild of the node. If refChild is null, insert newChild at the end of the list of children. This operation makes sense if and only if the EARMARK node is a markup item and its type is Collection.Type.Sequence.

Specified by:
insertBefore in interface EARMARKHierarchicalNode
Parameters:
newChild - the node to insert.
refChild - the reference node, i.e., the node before which the new node must be inserted.
Returns:
the node being inserted.
Throws:
EARMARKGraphException - if [WRONG_DOCUMENT_ERR] newChild or refChild were created from a different document than this one or if [NOCHILD_ERR] refChild is not a child of the node.

isEqualNode

public boolean isEqualNode(EARMARKNode node)

This method checks if the document is equal to another node.

A document is equal to another node either if they are the same node (isSameNode) or if they are both EARMARK documents and their structures are equal (i.e., they contains equal nodes in the same hierarchical order).

Specified by:
isEqualNode in interface EARMARKNode
Parameters:
node - the node to compare equality with.
Returns:
true if the nodes are equal, false otherwise.

isStructurallyEqualNode

public boolean isStructurallyEqualNode(EARMARKNode node)

This method checks if the document is equal to another node.

A document is structurally equivalent to another node if they are both EARMARK documents and their structures are structurally equivalent (i.e., they contains structurally equivalent nodes in the same hierarchical order).

Specified by:
isStructurallyEqualNode in interface EARMARKNode
Parameters:
node - the node to compare equality with.
Returns:
true if the nodes are equal, false otherwise.

adoptNode

public EARMARKChildNode adoptNode(EARMARKChildNode n)

This method adopts a node of another document in this one. The adoption is recursive: adopting a node 'n' means to adopt all the other descendant nodes of 'n'.

As for the method copyNode, only items that are not already present in the document will be correctly adopted. This means that an item, having identifier "ID" and belonging to a particular document, will be adopted if and only if in the adopting document does not exist any item having "ID" as identifier.

If the node to be adopted is a range, its referred docuverse will be copied as well.

In case of success, all the adopted nodes will be removed from the original document.

Parameters:
n - the node to adopt.
Returns:
the node adopted.
